card.desc: Is there anyone in your city doing a great job promoting their work? If so, let’s make sure to connect with them and pick their brain about what works, what doesn’t, etc.
card.name: Who's Doing a Great Job in City?

card.desc:
Instagram and Facebook are great ways to find new fans, but an ineffective way to engage deeply with them and promote new music.

Let’s explore implementing a simple newsletter / mailing list for your fans.
card.name: Newsletter / Mailing List

card.desc:
It’s a hard conversation to have with yourself, but it’s worthwhile to make an honest assessment of your current abilities as a musician.

Are there areas in which you can improve upon? Are there lessons, classes, books, mentors that can help you further refine your sound?
card.name: Honest Assessment of Your Abilities

card.desc: Perform at open mic nights: Regularly participate in open mic nights to gain exposure and attract new fans. Encourage audience members to join your mailing list or follow his social media accounts to stay updated on future performances.
card.name: Open Mic Nights

old.desc: Perform at open mic nights: Regularly participate in open mic nights to gain exposure and attract new fans. Encourage audience members to join your friend's mailing list or follow his social media accounts to stay updated on future performances.

card.desc: Book local gigs: Approach local venues, cafes, and bars to secure paid engagements. Prepare a demo or live performance video to showcase your talent and style. Build relationships with venue owners or talent bookers to establish a regular performance schedule.
card.name: Local Gigs

old.desc: Book local gigs: Approach local venues, cafes, and bars to secure paid engagements. Prepare a demo or live performance video to showcase your friend's talent and style. Build relationships with venue owners or talent bookers to establish a regular performance schedule.

card.desc: Seek media coverage: Write a press release and distribute it to local newspapers, music blogs, and online magazines. Research journalists or bloggers who cover music in your specific genre and reach out to them personally, offering an exclusive interview or a preview of upcoming releases.
card.name: Seeking Media Coverage

old.desc: Seek media coverage: Write a press release and distribute it to local newspapers, music blogs, and online magazines. Research journalists or bloggers who cover music in your friend's genre and reach out to them personally, offering an exclusive interview or a preview of upcoming releases.

card.desc: Produce quality recordings: Work with a reputable recording studio or producer to ensure high-quality recordings that capture the essence of your performances. Professional-sounding music can significantly impact how it is received by the audience.
card.name: High Quality Recordings

old.desc: Produce quality recordings: Work with a reputable recording studio or producer to ensure high-quality recordings that capture the essence of your friend's performances. Professional-sounding music can significantly impact how it is received by the audience.

card.desc: Plan small tours: Identify nearby cities or regions where your music may be well received. Contact venues, local radio stations, and music promoters in those areas to arrange a series of shows, aiming to build a fanbase in new locations.
card.name: Planning Small Tours

old.desc: Plan small tours: Identify nearby cities or regions where your friend's music may be well received. Contact venues, local radio stations, and music promoters in those areas to arrange a series of shows, aiming to build a fanbase in new locations.

card.desc: Leverage online platforms: Explore opportunities to perform live on platforms like Twitch or YouTube, where you can reach a global audience. Collaborate with popular streamers or content creators in your musical niche for additional exposure.
card.name: Leverage Existing Online Platforms

old.desc: Leverage online platforms: Explore opportunities to perform live on platforms like Twitch or YouTube, where your friend can reach a global audience. Collaborate with popular streamers or content creators in the music niche for additional exposure.

card.desc: Submit music to playlists and radio stations: Research online playlists and independent radio stations that focus on your genre. Submit your music for consideration and encourage fans to request your songs on local radio stations.

card.desc: Produce quality recordings: Work with a reputable recording studio or producer to ensure high-quality recordings that capture the essence of your friend's performances. Professional-sounding music can significantly impact how it is received by the audience.

card.desc: Create compelling visuals: Invest in professional photoshoots and create eye-catching artwork for album covers, singles, and promotional materials. Visuals play a crucial role in attracting new listeners.
card.name: Compelling Visuals

card.desc: Consider house shows, dinner parties, private events: Organize intimate acoustic concerts at private residences, inviting friends, family, and fans. This can create a unique and personal experience while also allowing for direct fan engagement.
card.name: House Shows, Dinner Parties, Private Events
House Shows, Dinner Parties, Private Events

card.desc: Book local gigs: Approach local venues, cafes, and bars to secure paid engagements. Prepare a demo or live performance video to showcase your friend's talent and style. Build relationships with venue owners or talent bookers to establish a regular performance schedule.

card.desc: Engage with the local music community: Join forums or online communities dedicated to local music scenes. Participate in discussions, share advice, and attend relevant events to network with industry professionals, such as talent scouts, agents, and venue owners.

card.desc: Seek collaboration opportunities online: Use platforms like SoundBetter or social media groups to find producers, instrumentalists, or other artists who may be interested in collaborating on new songs or recording sessions.

card.desc: Connect with local musicians: Attend open mic nights, music festivals, and events to meet other artists and build a supportive network. Collaborate on projects, share gigs, and cross-promote each other's work.

card.desc: Take a moment to capture any local musicians, artists, creators that you’d like to work with. Is there anyone in Austin you think is doing a great job promoting their work?

card.desc: Let’s analyze your existing digital distribution and brainstorm on new ways for more people online to find your music.
card.name: Digital Distribution

card.desc:
Let’s analyze your existing social media accounts and think of creative ways to utilize them further and increase engagement cross-platform.

We’ll also need to create a game plan for keeping the content relevant, fresh and up-to-date while increasing (and measuring) engagement across all platforms.

Finally, we’ll need to create a frictionless environment for fans, content creators and other musicians to collaborate with you.
card.name: Social Media Analysis + Planning

card.desc:
Let’s explore the creation of a new website designed to showcase your music, provides information about upcoming shows, and offers a way for fans to contact you.

We’ll make sure to include a biography, music samples, videos, and links to social media profiles.
card.name: Website Refresh
